transcripts.text: The boy who didn't like white people.  Billy was a smart boy who always listened to his teacher and did all his homework.  Every day when Billy got home, he would tell his dad about all the things he had learned at school.  One day, Billy came home and said to his dad...

Today I learned about all the terrible things white people have done.  White people had slaves and stole land and killed everybody who wasn't white.  The world would be a much better place if white people never existed.
Billy's dad thought for a moment and then replied, I'll tell you what, Billy.
Tomorrow we'll spend the whole day as though white people never existed.

That night, Billy went off to bed excited about what a wonderful day they would have tomorrow.  The next day, Billy ran downstairs to the kitchen to have his favourite breakfast cereal, Coco Pops.  But when he got to the table, there was only a bowl of cold rice.  Dad!  Billy asked.  Where's my bowl of Coco Pops?  Billy's dad replied.
Oh, there'll be no Coco Popping today, Billy.  Coco Pops were invented by white people.
Well, I'm not eating this cold rice.  I'm going to go outside and play on my trampoline.
Oh, there'll be no trampolining today, Billy.  Trampolines were invented by white people.
Billy thought and thought until he came up with something he was sure wasn't invented by white people.  I know, he said.
I'm going to listen to my favourite hip-hop band on the radio.
Oh, there'll be no hip-hopping today, Billy.  The radio was invented by white people.
Now Billy had become very angry and yelled, Well, I hate today, and I'm going to bed and sleeping until tomorrow.
But Billy's dad said, Oh, but there'll be no tomorrow, Billy.  You have Ebola.
And that was the last anyone saw of Billy, the boy who didn't like white people.
